titleStmt.title: William W. Prater to Beriah Magoffin
CWG10553

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: To B. Magoffin Governor of Kentucky

Your petitioner Wm W. Prater Would represent to your Excellency that Sometime in the year 1860 this petition was in Company with one of his (nephews) Wm W. Williams and Said Williams was to some extent intoxicated they was playing pranks on One another and Eventually Said Said Williams got in a passion And thro threw a glass at this petitioner this and this petitioner never repelled the assualt for on his part he represents to your honor that he never had any malice toward Said Williams altho We were arrested and both were fined & the Jury assessed a fine against this petitioner for $31,50 and the Execution is now in the hands of the officer who will proceed to collect the Same unless restrained by your honor

Wm W WilliamsPrater
Wm W. Prater
the undersigned petitionersSubcribers Join in the prayer of the above petitioner for the remission of his fine in consequence of his poor Condition and large family

Wm. S. Adams
A, P, Cooper Esqr
Samuel Rice
T. C. Patrick
Eli Lemaster
Thomas Hackworth
John N Power
William Patrick
George Perkins
W P Salyer
Wm Conly
Lewis T. Toby
William. P. Bailey
Alexander Patrick
A, C, Bailey

Magoffin J. P.
$350 } assault
W. W. Prater
